meanings.definition: Money in the form of coins or banknotes, especially that which is immediately available.
meanings.sent1: I always keep some cash in my wallet for emergencies.
meanings.sent2: She paid for the groceries with cash at the supermarket.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepts cash, no credit cards allowed!
meanings.sent4: His hard work finally turned into cash when he received his paycheck.
meanings.sent5: The sound of coins jingling in his pocket was a comforting reminder of his cash reserves.

meanings.definition: To give or obtain cash for (a check, money order, etc.).
meanings.sent1: He needed to cash his paycheck before the bank closed.
meanings.sent2: The teller cashed the customer's check without any issues.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she would cash in her lottery ticket and retire early.
meanings.sent4: The opportunity to cash in on the investment was too good to pass up.
meanings.sent5: The player decided to cash out his chips and leave the casino while he was ahead.

meanings.definition: To exchange for or convert into cash.
meanings.sent1: They wanted to cash their foreign currency at the airport.
meanings.sent2: The pawnshop offered to cash the old jewelry for a fair price.
meanings.sent3: He decided to cash out his loyalty points for a gift card.
meanings.sent4: The decision to cash in the stocks proved to be profitable.
meanings.sent5: She planned to cash out her savings bonds to fund her trip abroad.
